intro: Orophochilus stipulaceus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study. Orophochilus stipulaceus is also valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
